sentences.english: I will be deeply grateful to you for your kindness for the rest of my life.
sentences.chinese: 您对我的恩情使我终身铭感。

sentences.english: But the Elephant did not forget the kindness of the Carpenters.
sentences.chinese: 但是，大象没有忘记木匠们的恩情。

sentences.english: How can I reward your kindness?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么才能报答你的恩情呢？

sentences.english: The cloud valuable father often sends the diet, meets with it bedroom, the benevolence like lives.
sentences.chinese: 云宝父常致饮食，与之寝接，恩情如生。

sentences.english: I shall always remember your kindness.
sentences.chinese: 我将永远铭记你的恩情。

sentences.english: Never shall I forget your kindness.
How can I ever repay your kindness.
sentences.chinese: 我如何才能报答你对我的恩情。

sentences.english: I owe you a debt of gratitude which I shall never be able to repay.
sentences.chinese: 我永远报答不尽你的恩情。

sentences.english: I shall never forget your kindness as long as I live.
sentences.chinese: 只要我还活着，我决不忘记你的恩情。

sentences.english: Love in the end, is kindness.
She never imagined that the deer could remember her kindness.
sentences.chinese: 她从来没想过那只鹿会记得她的恩情。

sentences.english: I can never repay you for your kindness.
sentences.chinese: 你对我的恩情我永远也报答不完。

definition: a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
hard to forget even after one's teeth fall out (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
your favor amounts to being given a new lease on life (idiom)
to pay a debt of gratitude/to repay a kindness
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
lit. will not be forgotten even after one's teeth fall out/to remember as long as one lives/unforgettable (idiom)
